name: shebeen
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a place, especially in Ireland or Scotland, where alcoholic drinks can be bought and drunk, sometimes illegally: "The Irish way is to go back to some shebeen and carry on with the whiskey all night long," she replied. He got his education in illegal shebeens, following reggae sound systems.
a place in a South African township (= a town where Black people lived during apartheid) where alcoholic drinks can be bought and drunk legally: An excellent guide took me to a South African shebeen. The van makes its way through the township's narrow streets, alive with shebeens blasting music.
More examplesFewer examplesThe clientele of the shebeen had discussed this the night before.One suggestion is that Molly Maguire was a woman who owned a shebeen where members of the society met.Shacks and shebeens were piled on to trucks and removed.
